pageContext.claim: “Democrats don't like the issue anymore, because they know we're right. When you see what's happening over there, they know we're right. They sort of let that one sail through. They got tired of that wall fight. That wall fight was not good for them, politically, I can tell you, right?”
pageContext.analysis: Democrats continue to oppose Trump's wall. He has downshifted his ambitions and is now building a system of see-through, bollard-style fences -- which can be cut through with a modified power saw. It is notable that Democrats succeeded in blocking funding for the original wall project while in the minority in both chambers of Congress during Trump's first two years in office.
